name: feijoa
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the oval, green fruit of a small South American tree, or the tree itself: The feijoa had a tangy, perfumed flavour and flesh like a melon. Feijoas are often eaten fresh in salads or made into preserves. The feijoa is a small tree with bluish green leaves.
More examplesFewer examplesMost varieties of feijoa in cultivation today are from Australia, New Zealand, or the USA.The lemon sorbet was served with a feijoa sauce.Their feijoa ice cream is particularly delicious, although something of an acquired taste.The flowers of the feijoa have white petals and bristly, scarlet stamens.
